name: Make figures great again
tagline: Scientific communication should be like a Trump Steak: dry & well done.
body: ![neck](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dblarremore/make_figures_great_again/master/neck.jpg) Make Figures Great Again (MFGA) is _the_ best way to make plots. Period. With nine terrific color palettes, and Python and Adobe modules, MFGA is hands down—and look, we know something about hands here folks—_the_ most incredible way to elevate the class and impact of your figures. American scientific figures used to be great. Make them great again. # Installation and Use ### Python installation pip install make-figures-great-again ### Python usage example # Make a plot with the "neck" color palette (top of this webpage) import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import make_figures_great_again fig, (ax_left, ax_right) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(6,3)) fractions = [0.5,0.05,0.15,0.05,0.15,0.1,] # Import some terrific colors terrific_colors = make_figures_great_again.the_best_colors.neck_6.mpl_colors # Default (Ugly, just awful) ax_left.pie(fractions)   # The greatest, terrific colors ax_right.pie(fractions, colors=terrific_colors,) plt.show() ### Adobe installation and use Just download the palette below each inspirational photograph below. Then open the .aco file in Photoshop. # ↓ Nine simply outstanding palettes ↓ ### orange ![orange](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dblarremore/make_figures_great_again/master/orange.jpg)
